summary: The Vietnam Human Rights Act aims to prioritize human rights and the rule of law in US-Vietnam relations. It proposes sanctions for human rights violations in Vietnam, specifically targeting officials involved in arbitrary detention, corruption, and online censorship. The bill addresses internet freedom, calling for actions to combat online censorship and surveillance. It also addresses religious freedom, proposing the designation of Vietnam as a Country of Particular Concern due to human rights violations. The Act mandates annual reports on US-Vietnam human rights dialogues.
